wikitext.*:
{{Artist infobox | name=The Brothers Hildebrandt | image=The Brothers Hildebrandt.png | born=[[23 January|January 23]], [[1939]] | died=Greg: [[October 31]], [[2024]]
Tim: [[11 June|June 11]], [[2006]] | education= | style= | images=[[:Category:Images by The Brothers Hildebrandt|Gallery]] | location= | website=[http://www.brothershildebrandt.com/ The Brothers Hildebrandt]
[https://timhildebrandt.net/ Tim Hildebrandt] }} '''The Brothers Hildebrandt''' were a duo of fantasy artists consisting of the twin brothers '''Greg Hildebrandt''' ([[23 January|January 23]], [[1939]] - [[October 31]], [[2024]]) and '''Tim Hildebrandt''' (January 23, [[1939]] â€“ [[11 June|June 11]], [[2006]]). The brothers have been recognized artists in the world of [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]-inspired art. Other art includes the original poster art of ''[http://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Star_Wars:_The_Art_of_the_Brothers_Hildebrandt Star Wars]'' and over a hundred ''[http://marvel.wikia.com/wiki/Hildebrandt_Brothers/Gallery Marvel Masterpieces]'', including ''Swimsuit Specials''. They created reference photographs prior to painting many of their pieces and both preferred to work on Masonite rather than Canvas.[https://steemit.com/blog/@inber/hildebrandt-brothers-tolkien-calendar-chapter-two-my-stories-about-illustrators-tom-bombadil Hildebrandt brothers Tolkien calendar - chapter two, my stories about illustrators:) Tom Bombadil] Until Tim's death, the twins painted together, or in shifts, dependent of the time they had for a piece of art. After a struggle with diabetes, Tim passed away on [[11 June|June 11]], [[2006]]. ==The Lord of the Rings== After seeing [[The J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar 1975|a Tolkien calendar]] with [[Tim Kirk]]'s art, they responded to a call for artists by [[Ballantine Books|Ballantine]]. Their art was well-liked, and they were commissioned to illustrate the [[1976 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar|1976 Ballantine calendar]]. More calendars followed: [[1977 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar|1977]], [[1978 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar|1978]] - and they sold a record one million calendars. They moved their scope to other large projects, but kept producing Tolkien artwork. In [[2001]], ''[[Greg and Tim Hildebrandt: The Tolkien Years]]'' was published by Greg's son, Gregory Jr. Following the release of this collection, Ballantine began to reissue their popular Tolkien Calendars starting in [[The Brothers Hildebrandt 2002 Calendar|2002]]. ==Published artwork== * [[1976]] - ''[[1976 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar|Tolkien Calendar]]'' * [[1977]] - ''[[1977 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar|Tolkien Calendar]]'' * [[1978]] - ''[[1978 J.R.R. Tolkien Calendar|Tolkien Calendar]]'' * [[1979]] - ''[[The Art of the Brothers Hildebrandt]]'' * [[1985]] - ''[[From Tolkien to Oz]]'' (by William McGuire) * [[1992]] - ''[[J.R.R. Tolkien: Architect of Middle-earth]]'' (by [[Daniel Grotta]]) * [[2001]] - ''[[Greg and Tim Hildebrandt: The Tolkien Years]]'' * [[2002]] - ''[[The Brothers Hildebrandt 2002 Calendar|Tolkien Calendar]]'' * [[2003]] - ''[[The Tolkien Artwork of Greg and Tim Hildebrandt Postcard Calendar 2003|Postcard Calendar]]'' * [[2004]] - ''[[The Tolkien Art of the Brothers Hildebrandt 2004 Calendar|Tolkien Calendar]]'' * [[2005]] - ''[[The Tolkien Art of the Brothers Hildebrandt 2005 Calendar|Tolkien Calendar]]'' * [[2005]] - ''[[The Tolkien Art of the Brothers Hildebrandt 2005 Calendar (mini)|Tolkien Calendar (mini)]]'' * [[2006]] - ''[[The Tolkien art of the Brothers Hildebrandt 2006 Calendar|Tolkien Calendar]]''. ==Awards== * [[1992]] - '''[http://www.worldfantasy.org/awards/1992.html World Fantasy Award]''', Best Artist (Tim Hildebrandt). ==See also== * [[:Category:Images by The Brothers Hildebrandt|Images by The Brothers Hildebrandt]] ==External links== * '''[http://www.brothershildebrandt.com/ Official Website]''' * [https://www.spiderwebart.com/default.asp spiderwebart.com] (Official online store) * [https://www.spiderwebart.com/memorial/2006-06-12_tim/TimHildebrandt61206.html The Tim Hildebrandt Memorial] * [https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bX0dE-oXzwMl Greg Hildebrandt: HVAtvcom Issue 4] on YouTube (video interview) * [https://theprancingponypodcast.com/2019/06/30/131-visualizing-middle-earth-an-interview-with-greg-hildebrandt/ Visualizing Middle-earth: An Interview with Greg Hildebrandt] (Episode 131 of [[The Prancing Pony Podcast]]) {{References}} {{IllustratorsCalendars}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Hildebrandt, Brothers}} [[Category:American people]] [[Category:Artists]] [[Category:People by name]]
